thread.title: Qld's Acland mine a step closer
thread.title_full: Qld's Acland mine a step closer

title: Qld's Acland mine a step closer
text:
View Photo 

The controversial expansion of the Acland open-cut coal mine is a step closer to being approved after the Queensland government released a draft environmental authority for the project. 
Queensland Resource Council chief executive Michael Roche is expecting green groups to try and oppose the draft authority for New Hope Coal's $900 million project, northwest of Toowoomba, in the state's Land Court. 
"We fully expect all of the green activists' bag of tricks will be deployed against the continuation of the New Acland Mine and the hundreds of jobs for locals it can deliver," he said. @YahooNZBusiness on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Qld's Acland mine a step closer AAP
